clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Simple Needle Guide Device for Ultrasound-guided Internal Jugular Vein Catheterization in Cardiac Surgical Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Simple Needle Guide Device for Ultrasound-guided Internal Jugular Vein Catheterization in Cardiac Surgical Patients: a Randomized-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of simple needle guide device for ultrasound-guided internal jugular vein catheterization in cardiac surgical patients

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: sono with simple needle guide device group sono only group
study_design_info.masking_description: participants, investicator, outcome assessors will be blinded for group allocation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 minutes after insertion of puncture needle
primary_outcome.description: First access success rate was defined as the number of sono-guided catheterization obtained within first attempt.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: defined as the time in seconds between the beginning of the procedure and guide-wire insertion
incidence of Pneumothorax, Haemothorax, Hydrothorax, carotid artery puncture, Hematoma, Malpositions, puncture of posterior wall of internal jugular vein

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: In order to measure the degree of difficulty felt by the subjects during the procedure, a 100mm visual analogue scale was used to measure 10 difficulty levels (100mm; ease, 0mm ; difficult)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The number of attempts was counted each time a subject inserted a guide needle into the neck surface, followed by withdrawal, redirection, or reinsertion.

arm_group.description: Arm Description: Patients in this group are assigned to receive internal jugular vein catheterization guided by ultrasound and simple needle guide device.
Patients in this group are assigned to receive internal jugular vein catheterization guided by ultrasound without simple needle guide device.

intervention.description: In Group D, simple needle guide device was attached to the sono probe. Device was designed to assist the detection of the puncture site. After induction of anesthesia, both the device and sono-guided internal jugular vein catheterization was performed.
In Group S, simple needle guide device was not attached to the sono probe. After induction of anesthesia, only sono-guided internal jugular vein catheterization was performed.
